title: Getting help with ggnormalviolin
text: Thanks using ggnormalviolin. filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible. Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site. Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed. right place, need file issue, please review “File issues” paragraph tidyverse contributing guidelines. Thanks help!

title: ggnormalviolin
text: Suppose want highlight two tails distributions. Set p_tails specify total area tails. Thus, p_tail = 0.05, tail represent outermost 2.5% distributions (.e, 0.05 = 2 &mult; 0.025). Figure 2: shade violin tails Suppose want highly upper tails. Set p_upper_tail proportion desired. Figure 3: shade upper tails Analogously, can highlight lower tails setting p_lower_tail parameter. Figure 4: shade lower tails defaults highlighting accomplished selecting subset whole distribution, setting tail_fill black, making black fill transparent setting tail_alpha = 0.4. Setting values colors levels transparency can dramatically change look plot. Figure 5: style normal violins
code: p + geom_normalviolin(p_tail = 0.05) p + geom_normalviolin(p_upper_tail = 0.05) p + geom_normalviolin(p_lower_tail = 0.05) p +    geom_normalviolin(     p_tail = 0.05,     tail_fill = "white",     tail_alpha = 0.8,     color = "gray20",     linewidth = 0.1   )

title: ggnormalviolin
text: want omit left right side violins, can set face_left face_right parameters FALSE. Figure 6: make half-violins

title: ggnormalviolin
text: can set width violin size desired. Figure 7: set violin width constant value want shape distribution remain constant, map width parameter multiple standard deviation. Figure 8: set violin width proportional standard deviation

title: ggnormalviolin
text: default, normal violins extend 4 standard deviations directions. Use nsigma parameter set different value. Figure 9: set violin height set limits y scale, possible violins distorted cut pieces. Figure 10: distorted plot due limits set narrowly occurs data outside limits discarded, breaking polygons compose violins smaller pieces. prevent behavior, set upper_limit lower_limit parameters equal limits specified y scale (values wish). Figure 11: set plot limits prevent image distortion Alternately, can set limits ggplot2::coord_cartesian (coord_* functions), zoom plot instead discarding data. Figure 12: set zooming limits using coord_* function
code: p + geom_normalviolin(nsigma = 1.5) p +   geom_normalviolin() +   ylim(50, 140) p +   geom_normalviolin(lower_limit = 50, upper_limit = 140) +   ylim(50, 140) p +   geom_normalviolin() +   coord_cartesian(ylim = c(50, 140))

title: Creates normal violins with specified means and standard deviations — geom_normalviolin
code: geom_normalviolin(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   mu = NULL,   sigma = NULL,   nsigma = 4,   p_tail = 0,   p_lower_tail = p_tail/2,   p_upper_tail = p_tail/2,   tail_fill = "black",   tail_alpha = 0.4,   width = 0.6,   upper_limit = NA,   lower_limit = NA,   face_left = TRUE,   face_right = TRUE,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   ... )

title: Creates normal violins with specified means and standard deviations — geom_normalviolin
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). mu vector means sigma vector standard deviations nsigma number standard deviations violin extend p_tail 2-tailed proportion highlighted. Can overridden p_lower_tail /p_upper_tail p_lower_tail proportion distribution highlighted lower tail. Defaults half `p_tail`. p_upper_tail proportion distribution highlighted upper tail. Defaults half `p_tail`. tail_fill fill color tails tail_alpha alpha value tails width Width normal violin upper_limit upper limit polygons. Needed case setting limits scale_y_continuous ylim distorts polygons. lower_limit lower limit polygons. Needed case setting limits scale_y_continuous ylim distorts polygons. face_left Display left half violins. Defaults `TRUE` face_right Display right half violins. Defaults `TRUE` na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders(). ... arguments passed layer()'s params argument. arguments broadly fall one 4 categories . Notably, arguments position argument, aesthetics required can passed .... Unknown arguments part 4 categories ignored. Static aesthetics mapped scale, fixed value apply layer whole. example, colour = "red" linewidth = 3. geom's documentation Aesthetics section lists available options. 'required' aesthetics passed params. Please note passing unmapped aesthetics vectors technically possible, order required length guaranteed parallel input data. constructing layer using stat_*() function, ... argument can used pass parameters geom part layer. example stat_density(geom = "area", outline.type = ""). geom's documentation lists parameters can accept. Inversely, constructing layer using geom_*() function, ... argument can used pass parameters stat part layer. example geom_area(stat = "density", adjust = 0.5). stat's documentation lists parameters can accept. key_glyph argument layer() may also passed .... can one functions described key glyphs, change display layer legend.

title: Creates normal violins with specified means and standard deviations — geom_normalviolin
text: ggplot2 layer can added plot created   [ggplot2::ggplot()].

title: Creates normal violins with specified means and standard deviations — geom_normalviolin
text: geom_normviolin understands following aesthetics (required aesthetics bold): x mu (mean normal distribution) sigma (standard deviation normal distribution) width (width violin) nsigma (number standard deviations violins extend) p_tail (2-tailed proportion tails highlighted) p_upper_tail (proportion upper tails highlighted) p_lower_tail (proportion lower tails highlighted) face_left (display left half violin?) face_right (display right half violin?) color (lines) fill alpha (fills) group linetype linewidth

title: Creates normal violins with specified means and standard deviations — geom_normalviolin
code: library(ggplot2) d <- data.frame(   dist = c("A", "B"),   dist_mean = c(80, 90),   dist_sd = c(15, 10))  ggplot(data = d, aes(   x = dist,   mu = dist_mean,   sigma = dist_sd,   fill = dist)) +   geom_normalviolin() +   theme(legend.position = "none")
